sentences.zh: 鄭桓公友者，周厲王少子而宣王庶弟也。

translations.literal: Zheng Huan Gong You was Zhou Li Wang's youngest son and Xuan Wang's concubine younger brother.

sentences.zh: 宣王立二十二年，友初封于鄭。

translations.literal: In Xuan Wang's twenty-second year, You was initially enfeoffed at Zheng.

sentences.zh: 封三十三歲，百姓皆便愛之。

translations.literal: Enfeoffed for thirty-three years, all the common people found him convenient and loved him.

sentences.zh: 幽王以為司徒。

translations.literal: You Wang made him Si Tu.

sentences.zh: 和集周民，周民皆說，河雒之閒，人便思之。

translations.literal: He harmonized and gathered the Zhou people. The Zhou people were all pleased. Between the He and Luo rivers, people conveniently thought of him.

sentences.zh: 為司徒一歲，幽王以褒后故，王室治多邪，諸侯或畔之。

translations.literal: As Si Tu for one year, You Wang because of the Bao Hou affair, the wang chamber's governance had much evil. Some feudal lords rebelled against it.

sentences.zh: 於是桓公問太史伯曰：「王室多故，予安逃死乎？」

translations.literal: Thereupon Huan Gong asked Tai Shi Bo said: 'Wang chamber many troubles, I where escape death?'

sentences.zh: 太史伯對曰：「獨雒之東土，河濟之南可居。」

translations.literal: Tai Shi Bo replied said: 'Only Luo east land, He Ji south can reside.'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「何以？」

translations.literal: Gong said: 'Why?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「地近虢、鄶，虢、鄶之君貪而好利，百姓不附。

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Land near Guo, Xu, Guo, Xu lords greedy and fond profit, common people not attach.

sentences.zh: 今公為司徒，民皆愛公，公誠請居之，虢、鄶之君見公方用事，輕分公地。

translations.literal: Now the gong is Si Tu. The people all love the gong. If the gong sincerely requests to reside there, the lords of Guo and Xu, seeing the gong just in power, will lightly divide land for the gong.

sentences.zh: 公誠居之，虢、鄶之民皆公之民也。」

translations.literal: Gong sincerely reside there, Guo, Xu people all gong people.'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「吾欲南之江上，何如？」

translations.literal: Gong said: 'I desire south to Jiang Shang, what like?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「昔祝融為高辛氏火正，其功大矣，而其於周未有興者，楚其後也。

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Former Zhu Rong as Gao Xin Shi fire official, his merit great, but he at Zhou not yet had prosperous, Chu his descendant.

sentences.zh: 周衰，楚必興。

translations.literal: When Zhou declines, Chu will certainly prosper.

sentences.zh: 興，非鄭之利也。」

translations.literal: Prosper, not Zheng profit.'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「吾欲居西方，何如？」

translations.literal: Gong said: 'I desire reside west, what like?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「其民貪而好利，難久居。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Their people greedy and fond profit, difficult long reside.'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「周衰，何國興者？」

translations.literal: Gong said: 'Zhou declines, which states prosper?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「齊、秦、晉、楚乎？

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Qi, Qin, Jin, Chu?'

sentences.zh: 夫齊，姜姓，伯夷之後也，伯夷佐堯典禮。

translations.literal: Indeed Qi, of Jiang surname, is Bo Yi's descendant. Bo Yi assisted Yao in managing rites.

sentences.zh: 秦，嬴姓，伯翳之後也，伯翳佐舜懷柔百物。

translations.literal: Qin, of Ying surname, is Bo Yi's descendant. Bo Yi assisted Shun in pacifying and soothing the hundred things.

sentences.zh: 及楚之先，皆嘗有功於天下。

translations.literal: And Chu's ancestors all once had merit in the world.

sentences.zh: 而周武王克紂後，成王封叔虞于唐，其地阻險，以此有德與周衰并，亦必興矣。」

translations.literal: But Zhou Wu Wang conquered Zhou after, Cheng Wang enfeoffed Shu Yu at Tang, his land obstructed dangerous, with this virtuous with Zhou decline together, also certainly prosper.'

sentences.zh: 桓公曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Huan Gong said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 於是卒言王，東徙其民雒東，而虢、鄶果獻十邑，竟國之。

translations.literal: Thereupon he finally spoke to the wang and moved his people east of Luo. Guo and Xu indeed offered ten cities and completed the state.

sentences.zh: 二歲，犬戎殺幽王於驪山下，并殺桓公。

translations.literal: After two years, the Quan Rong killed You Wang below Li Shan and also killed Huan Gong.

sentences.zh: 鄭人共立其子掘突，是為武公。

translations.literal: The Zheng people together established his son Jue Tu. This was Wu Gong.

sentences.zh: 武公十年，娶申侯女為夫人，曰武姜。

translations.literal: In Wu Gong's tenth year, he took Shen Hou's daughter as his lady, named Wu Jiang.

sentences.zh: 生太子寤生，生之難，及生，夫人弗愛。

translations.literal: She gave birth to the crown prince Wu Sheng. The birth was difficult. When born, the lady did not love him.

sentences.zh: 後生少子叔段，段生易，夫人愛之。

translations.literal: Later she gave birth to a young son Shu Duan. Duan's birth was easy. The lady loved him.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，武公疾。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, Wu Gong fell ill.

sentences.zh: 夫人請公，欲立段為太子，公弗聽。

translations.literal: The lady requested the gong, desiring to establish Duan as crown prince. The gong did not listen.

sentences.zh: 是歲，武公卒，寤生立，是為莊公。

translations.literal: This year, Wu Gong died. Wu Sheng was established. This was Zhuang Gong.

sentences.zh: 莊公元年，封弟段於京，號太叔。

translations.literal: In Zhuang Gong's first year, he enfeoffed his younger brother Duan at Jing, naming him Tai Shu.

sentences.zh: 祭仲曰：「京大於國，非所以封庶也。」

translations.literal: Ji Zhong said: 'Jing larger than state, not what to enfeoff concubine.'

sentences.zh: 莊公曰：「武姜欲之，我弗敢奪也。」

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong said: 'Wu Jiang desires it, I not dare take away.'

sentences.zh: 段至京，繕治甲兵，與其母武姜謀襲鄭。

translations.literal: Duan arrived at Jing and repaired and prepared armor and troops. With his mother Wu Jiang he plotted to raid Zheng.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，段果襲鄭，武姜為內應。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Duan indeed raided Zheng. Wu Jiang provided inner support.

sentences.zh: 莊公發兵伐段，段走。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong mobilized troops to attack Duan. Duan fled.

sentences.zh: 伐京，京人畔段，段出走鄢。

translations.literal: He attacked Jing. The Jing people rebelled against Duan. Duan fled out to Yan.

sentences.zh: 鄢潰，段出奔共。

translations.literal: Yan collapsed. Duan fled out to Gong.

sentences.zh: 於是莊公遷其母武姜於城潁，誓言曰：「不至黃泉，毋相見也。」

translations.literal: Thereupon Zhuang Gong moved his mother Wu Jiang to Cheng Ying, swore said: 'Not reach yellow springs, not meet.'

sentences.zh: 居歲餘，已悔思母。

translations.literal: After residing more than a year, he already regretted and thought of his mother.

sentences.zh: 潁谷之考叔有獻於公，公賜食。

translations.literal: Kou Shu of Ying Gu had an offering to the gong. The gong granted food.

sentences.zh: 考叔曰：「臣有母，請君食賜臣母。」

translations.literal: Kou Shu said: 'Minister has mother, please lord food grant minister mother.'

sentences.zh: 莊公曰：「我甚思母，惡負盟，柰何？」

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong said: 'I very think mother, hate break oath, what to do?'

sentences.zh: 考叔曰：「穿地至黃泉，則相見矣。」

translations.literal: Kou Shu said: 'Dig earth reach yellow springs, then meet.'

sentences.zh: 於是遂從之，見母。

translations.literal: Thereupon he then followed it and saw his mother.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，宋繆公卒，公子馮奔鄭。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, Song Mu Gong died. Gong zi Feng fled to Zheng.

sentences.zh: 鄭侵周地，取禾。

translations.literal: Zheng invaded Zhou land and took grain.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，衛州吁弒其君桓公自立，與宋伐鄭，以馮故也。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Wei's Zhou Xu assassinated his lord Huan Gong and established himself. With Song he attacked Zheng, because of Feng's reason.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，始朝周桓王。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, he began to attend Zhou Huan Wang.

sentences.zh: 桓王怒其取禾，弗禮也。

translations.literal: Huan Wang was angered by his taking of grain and did not treat him with courtesy.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，莊公怒周弗禮，與魯易祊、許田。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Zhuang Gong was angered that Zhou showed no courtesy. With Lu he exchanged Beng and Xu fields.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，宋殺孔父。

translations.literal: In the thirty-third year, Song killed Kong Fu.

sentences.zh: 三十七年，莊公不朝周，周桓王率陳、蔡、虢、衛伐鄭。

translations.literal: In the thirty-seventh year, Zhuang Gong did not attend Zhou. Zhou Huan Wang led Chen, Cai, Guo, and Wei to attack Zheng.

sentences.zh: 莊公與祭仲、高渠彌發兵自救，王師大敗。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong with Ji Zhong and Gao Qu Mi mobilized troops to rescue themselves. The wang's troops were greatly defeated.

sentences.zh: 祝聸射中王臂。

translations.literal: Zhu Kui shot and hit the wang's arm.

sentences.zh: 祝聸請從之，鄭伯止之，曰：「犯長且難之，況敢陵天子乎？」

translations.literal: Zhu Kui requested pursue it, Zheng Bo stopped him, said: 'Offend elder moreover difficult it, moreover dare bully Son of Heaven?'

sentences.zh: 乃止。

translations.literal: They then stopped.

sentences.zh: 夜令祭仲問王疾。

translations.literal: At night he commanded Ji Zhong to ask about the wang's illness.

sentences.zh: 三十八年，北戎伐齊，齊使求救，鄭遣太子忽將兵救齊。

translations.literal: In the thirty-eighth year, the northern Rong attacked Qi. Qi sent a request for aid. Zheng sent crown prince Hu to lead troops and save Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊釐公欲妻之，忽謝曰：「我小國，非齊敵也。」

translations.literal: Qi Xi Gong desired marry him, Hu declined said: 'I small state, not Qi match.'

sentences.zh: 時祭仲與俱，勸使取之，曰：「君多內寵，太子無大援將不立，三公子皆君也。」

translations.literal: At time Ji Zhong with together, urged made take it, said: 'Lord many inner favorites, crown prince no great support will not establish, three gong zi all lords.'

sentences.zh: 所謂三公子者，太子忽，其弟突，次弟子亹也。

translations.literal: What are called the three gong zi: crown prince Hu, his younger brother Tu, and the next younger brother Wei.

sentences.zh: 四十三年，鄭莊公卒。

translations.literal: In the forty-third year, Zheng Zhuang Gong died.

sentences.zh: 初，祭仲甚有寵於莊公，莊公使為卿；

translations.literal: Initially, Ji Zhong very had favor with Zhuang Gong, Zhuang Gong made him minister;

sentences.zh: 公使娶鄧女，生太子忽，故祭仲立之，是為昭公。

translations.literal: The gong made him take a Deng woman. She gave birth to crown prince Hu. Therefore Ji Zhong established him. This was Zhao Gong.

sentences.zh: 莊公又娶宋雍氏女，生厲公突。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong moreover took a Song Yong clan woman. She gave birth to Li Gong Tu.

sentences.zh: 雍氏有寵於宋。

translations.literal: The Yong clan had favor in Song.

sentences.zh: 宋莊公聞祭仲之立忽，乃使人誘召祭仲而執之，曰：「不立突，將死。」

translations.literal: Song Zhuang Gong heard Ji Zhong established Hu, then sent person lured summoned Ji Zhong seized him, said: 'Not establish Tu, will die.'

sentences.zh: 亦執突以求賂焉。

translations.literal: He also seized Tu to seek a bribe there.

sentences.zh: 祭仲許宋，與宋盟。

translations.literal: Ji Zhong permitted Song and allied with Song.

sentences.zh: 以突歸，立之。

translations.literal: He returned with Tu and established him.

sentences.zh: 昭公忽聞祭仲以宋要立其弟突，九月（辛）［丁］亥，忽出奔衛。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong Hu heard that Ji Zhong, under duress from Song, had established his younger brother Tu. On the ninth month Ding Hai, Hu fled out to Wei.

sentences.zh: 己亥，突至鄭，立，是為厲公。

translations.literal: On Ji Hai, Tu arrived at Zheng and was established. This was Li Gong.

sentences.zh: 厲公四年，祭仲專國政。

translations.literal: In Li Gong's fourth year, Ji Zhong monopolized the state's governance.

sentences.zh: 厲公患之，陰使其婿雍糾欲殺祭仲。

translations.literal: Li Gong worried about it and secretly made his son-in-law Yong Jiu desire to kill Ji Zhong.

sentences.zh: 糾妻，祭仲女也，知之，謂其母曰：「父與夫孰親？」

translations.literal: Jiu wife, Ji Zhong daughter, knew it, told her mother said: 'Father and husband who closer?'

sentences.zh: 母曰：「父一而已，人盡夫也。」

translations.literal: Mother said: 'Father one only, people all husbands.'

sentences.zh: 女乃告祭仲，祭仲反殺雍糾，戮之於市。

translations.literal: The woman then told Ji Zhong. Ji Zhong instead killed Yong Jiu and executed him in the market.

sentences.zh: 厲公無柰祭仲何，怒糾曰：「謀及婦人，死固宜哉！」

translations.literal: Li Gong no what Ji Zhong, angered Jiu said: 'Plotted with woman, death certainly fitting!'

sentences.zh: 夏，厲公出居邊邑櫟。

translations.literal: In summer, Li Gong went out and resided in the border city of Li.

sentences.zh: 祭仲迎昭公忽，六月乙亥，復入鄭，即位。

translations.literal: Ji Zhong welcomed Zhao Gong Hu. On the sixth month Yi Hai, he again entered Zheng and took the position.

sentences.zh: 秋，鄭厲公突因櫟人殺其大夫單伯，遂居之。

translations.literal: In autumn, Zheng Li Gong Tu, because the Li people killed his grandee Shan Bo, then resided there.

sentences.zh: 諸侯聞厲公出奔，伐鄭，弗克而去。

translations.literal: The feudal lords heard that Li Gong had fled out. They attacked Zheng but did not conquer it and departed.

sentences.zh: 宋頗予厲公兵，自守於櫟，鄭以故亦不伐櫟。

translations.literal: Song rather gave Li Gong troops. He self-defended at Li. Zheng, because of this reason, also did not attack Li.

sentences.zh: 昭公二年，自昭公為太子時，父莊公欲以高渠彌為卿，太子忽惡之，莊公弗聽，卒用渠彌為卿。

translations.literal: In Zhao Gong's second year, from when Zhao Gong was crown prince, his father Zhuang Gong desired to make Gao Qu Mi a minister. Crown prince Hu hated it. Zhuang Gong did not listen and finally used Qu Mi as minister.

sentences.zh: 及昭公即位，懼其殺己，冬十月辛卯，渠彌與昭公出獵，射殺昭公於野。

translations.literal: When Zhao Gong took the position, he feared Qu Mi would kill him. In winter, tenth month Xin Mao, Qu Mi went hunting with Zhao Gong and shot and killed Zhao Gong in the fields.

sentences.zh: 祭仲與渠彌不敢入厲公，乃更立昭公弟子亹為君，是為子亹也，無謚號。

translations.literal: Ji Zhong and Qu Mi did not dare to enter Li Gong. They then again established Zhao Gong's younger brother Wei as lord. This was Zi Wei. He had no posthumous name.

sentences.zh: 子亹元年七月，齊襄公會諸侯於首止，鄭子亹往會，高渠彌相，從，祭仲稱疾不行。

translations.literal: In Zi Wei's first year, seventh month, Qi Xiang Gong assembled the feudal lords at Shou Zhi. Zheng Zi Wei went to the assembly. Gao Qu Mi assisted and followed. Ji Zhong claimed illness and did not go.

sentences.zh: 所以然者，子亹自齊襄公為公子之時，嘗會鬬，相仇，及會諸侯，祭仲請子亹無行。

translations.literal: The reason was that Zi Wei, from when Qi Xiang Gong was a gong zi, once assembled and fought, becoming mutual enemies. When assembling the feudal lords, Ji Zhong requested that Zi Wei not go.

sentences.zh: 子亹曰：「齊彊，而厲公居櫟，即不往，是率諸侯伐我，內厲公。

translations.literal: Zi Wei said: 'Qi strong, Li Gong resides Li, if not go, this leads feudal lords attack me, inner Li Gong.

sentences.zh: 我不如往，往何遽必辱，且又何至是！」

translations.literal: I not as go, go why hastily certainly humiliation, moreover what reach this!'

sentences.zh: 卒行。

translations.literal: He finally went.

sentences.zh: 於是祭仲恐齊并殺之，故稱疾。

translations.literal: Thereupon Ji Zhong feared that Qi would moreover kill him. Therefore he claimed illness.

sentences.zh: 子亹至，不謝齊侯，齊侯怒，遂伏甲而殺子亹。

translations.literal: Zi Wei arrived and did not thank the Qi hou. The Qi hou was angered and then hid armored troops and killed Zi Wei.

sentences.zh: 高渠彌亡歸，歸與祭仲謀，召子亹弟公子嬰於陳而立之，是為鄭子。

translations.literal: Gao Qu Mi fled and returned. He returned and plotted with Ji Zhong. They summoned Zi Wei's younger brother Gong Zi Ying from Chen and established him. This was Zheng Zi.

sentences.zh: 是歲，齊襄公使彭生醉拉殺魯桓公。

translations.literal: This year, Qi Xiang Gong made Peng Sheng get drunk and pull and kill Lu Huan Gong.

sentences.zh: 鄭子八年，齊人管至父等作亂，弒其君襄公。

translations.literal: In Zheng Zi's eighth year, Qi people Guan Zhi Fu and others made chaos and assassinated their lord Xiang Gong.

sentences.zh: 十二年，宋人長萬弒其君湣公。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Song people Chang Wan assassinated their lord Min Gong.

sentences.zh: 鄭祭仲死。

translations.literal: Zheng Ji Zhong died.

sentences.zh: 十四年，故鄭亡厲公突在櫟者使人誘劫鄭大夫甫假，要以求入。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, the former Zheng who fled Li Gong Tu at Li sent a person to lure and kidnap Zheng grandee Fu Jia, demanding to seek entry.

sentences.zh: 假曰：「捨我，我為君殺鄭子而入君。」

translations.literal: Jia said: 'Release me, I for lord kill Zheng Zi enter lord.'

sentences.zh: 厲公與盟，乃捨之。

translations.literal: Li Gong allied with him and then released him.

sentences.zh: 六月甲子，假殺鄭子及其二子而迎厲公突，突自櫟復入即位。

translations.literal: On the sixth month Jia Zi, Jia killed Zheng Zi and his two sons and welcomed Li Gong Tu. Tu from Li again entered and took the position.

sentences.zh: 初，內蛇與外蛇鬬於鄭南門中，內蛇死。

translations.literal: Initially, the inner snake and outer snake fought in the middle of Zheng's south gate. The inner snake died.

sentences.zh: 居六年，厲公果復入。

translations.literal: After residing six years, Li Gong indeed again entered.

sentences.zh: 入而讓其伯父原曰：「我亡國外居，伯父無意入我，亦甚矣。」

translations.literal: Entered reproached his paternal uncle Yuan said: 'I fled state outside resided, paternal uncle no intention enter me, also excessive.'

sentences.zh: 原曰：「事君無二心，人臣之職也。

translations.literal: Yuan said: 'Serve lord no two hearts, person minister duty.

sentences.zh: 原知罪矣。」

translations.literal: Yuan knew crime.'

sentences.zh: 遂自殺。

translations.literal: He then committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 厲公於是謂甫假曰：「子之事君有二心矣。」

translations.literal: Li Gong thereupon told Fu Jia said: 'You serve lord have two hearts.'

sentences.zh: 遂誅之。

translations.literal: He then executed him.

sentences.zh: 假曰：「重德不報，誠然哉！」

translations.literal: Jia said: 'Heavy virtue not repay, truly!'

sentences.zh: 厲公突後元年，齊桓公始霸。

translations.literal: In the year after Li Gong Tu, Qi Huan Gong began his hegemony.

sentences.zh: 五年，燕、衛與周惠王弟穨伐王，王出奔溫，立弟穨為王。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Yan and Wei with Zhou Hui Wang's younger brother Sui attacked the wang. The wang fled out to Wen. They established younger brother Sui as wang.

sentences.zh: 六年，惠王告急鄭，厲公發兵擊周王子穨，弗勝，於是與周惠王歸，王居于櫟。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Hui Wang urgently informed Zheng. Li Gong mobilized troops to attack Zhou wang zi Sui. He did not conquer. Thereupon he returned with Zhou Hui Wang. The wang resided at Li.

sentences.zh: 七年春，鄭厲公與虢叔襲殺王子穨而入惠王于周。

translations.literal: In the seventh year spring, Zheng Li Gong with Guo Shu raided and killed wang zi Sui and entered Hui Wang into Zhou.

sentences.zh: 秋，厲公卒，子文公踕立。

translations.literal: In autumn, Li Gong died. His son Wen Gong Jie was established.

sentences.zh: 厲公初立四歲，亡居櫟，居櫟十七歲，復入，立七歲，與亡凡二十八年。

translations.literal: Li Gong was initially established for four years. He fled and resided at Li for seventeen years. He again entered and was established for seven years. With the fleeing, altogether twenty-eight years.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，文公之賤妾曰燕姞，夢天與之蘭，曰：「余為伯鯈。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, Wen Gong humble concubine named Yan Ji, dreamed heaven gave her orchid, said: 'I for Bo Tao.

sentences.zh: 余，爾祖也。

translations.literal: I am your ancestor.

sentences.zh: 以是為而子，蘭有國香。」

translations.literal: With this be your son, orchid has state fragrance.'

sentences.zh: 以夢告文公，文公幸之，而予之草蘭為符。

translations.literal: She told the dream to Wen Gong. Wen Gong favored her and gave her a grass orchid as a tally.

sentences.zh: 遂生子，名曰蘭。

translations.literal: She then gave birth to a son, named Lan.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，晉公子重耳過，文公弗禮。

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, Jin gong zi Chong Er passed through. Wen Gong did not treat him with courtesy.

sentences.zh: 文公弟叔詹曰：「重耳賢，且又同姓，窮而過君，不可無禮。」

translations.literal: Wen Gong younger brother Shu Zhan said: 'Chong Er worthy, moreover same surname, poor passed lord, cannot without courtesy.'

sentences.zh: 文公曰：「諸侯亡公子過者多矣，安能盡禮之！」

translations.literal: Wen Gong said: 'Feudal lords fled gong zi passed many, how can all courtesy them!'

sentences.zh: 詹曰：「君如弗禮，遂殺之；

translations.literal: Zhan said: 'Lord if not courtesy, then kill him;

sentences.zh: 弗殺，使即反國，為鄭憂矣。」

translations.literal: Not kill, make immediately return country, becomes Zheng worry.'

sentences.zh: 文公弗聽。

translations.literal: Wen Gong did not listen.

sentences.zh: 三十七年春，晉公子重耳反國，立，是為文公。

translations.literal: In the thirty-seventh year spring, Jin gong zi Chong Er returned to his country and was established. This was Wen Gong.

sentences.zh: 秋，鄭入滑，滑聽命，已而反與衛，於是鄭伐滑。

translations.literal: In autumn, Zheng entered Hua. Hua obeyed the command, but already then turned and allied with Wei. Thereupon Zheng attacked Hua.

sentences.zh: 周襄王使伯服請滑。

translations.literal: Zhou Xiang Wang sent Bo Fu to request Hua.

sentences.zh: 鄭文公怨惠王之亡在櫟，而文公父厲公入之，而惠王不賜厲公爵祿，又怨襄王之與衛滑，故不聽襄王請而囚伯服。

translations.literal: Zheng Wen Gong resented that Hui Wang fled and resided at Li, and that Wen Gong's father Li Gong entered him, but Hui Wang did not grant Li Gong rank and emolument. He moreover resented Xiang Wang allying with Wei and Hua. Therefore he did not listen to Xiang Wang's request and imprisoned Bo Fu.

sentences.zh: 王怒，與翟人伐鄭，弗克。

translations.literal: The wang was angered and with the Di people attacked Zheng. He did not conquer.

sentences.zh: 冬，翟攻伐襄王，襄王出奔鄭，鄭文公居王于氾。

translations.literal: In winter, the Di attacked Xiang Wang. Xiang Wang fled out to Zheng. Zheng Wen Gong housed the wang at Fan.

sentences.zh: 三十八年，晉文公入襄王成周。

translations.literal: In the thirty-eighth year, Jin Wen Gong entered Xiang Wang into Cheng Zhou.

sentences.zh: 四十一年，助楚擊晉。

translations.literal: In the forty-first year, he assisted Chu in attacking Jin.

sentences.zh: 自晉文公之過無禮，故背晉助楚。

translations.literal: Because of Jin Wen Gong passing without courtesy, he therefore turned his back on Jin and assisted Chu.

sentences.zh: 四十三年，晉文公與秦穆公共圍鄭，討其助楚攻晉者，及文公過時之無禮也。

translations.literal: In the forty-third year, Jin Wen Gong with Qin Mu Gong together surrounded Zheng, punishing those who assisted Chu in attacking Jin, and Wen Gong's passing without courtesy at that time.

sentences.zh: 初，鄭文公有三夫人，寵子五人，皆以罪蚤死。

translations.literal: Initially, Zheng Wen Gong had three ladies and five favored sons. All died early because of crimes.

sentences.zh: 公怒，溉逐群公子。

translations.literal: The gong was angered and hastily drove away the group of gong zi.

sentences.zh: 子蘭奔晉，從晉文公圍鄭。

translations.literal: Zi Lan fled to Jin and followed Jin Wen Gong in surrounding Zheng.

sentences.zh: 時蘭事晉文公甚謹，愛幸之，乃私於晉，以求入鄭為太子。

translations.literal: At the time Lan served Jin Wen Gong very respectfully. He loved and favored him. He then privately allied with Jin to seek entering Zheng as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 晉於是欲得叔詹為僇。

translations.literal: Jin thereupon desired to obtain Shu Zhan for punishment.

sentences.zh: 鄭文公恐，不敢謂叔詹言。

translations.literal: Zheng Wen Gong feared and did not dare to tell Shu Zhan.

sentences.zh: 詹聞，言於鄭君曰：「臣謂君，君不聽臣，晉卒為患。

translations.literal: Zhan heard, spoke to Zheng lord said: 'Minister told lord, lord not listened minister, Jin finally became calamity.

sentences.zh: 然晉所以圍鄭，以詹，詹死而赦鄭國，詹之願也。」

translations.literal: However Jin reason surrounded Zheng, because Zhan, Zhan died then pardoned Zheng state, Zhan wish.'

sentences.zh: 乃自殺。

translations.literal: He then committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 鄭人以詹尸與晉。

translations.literal: The Zheng people gave Zhan's corpse to Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉文公曰：「必欲一見鄭君，辱之而去。」

translations.literal: Jin Wen Gong said: 'Certainly desire once see Zheng lord, humiliate him depart.'

sentences.zh: 鄭人患之，乃使人私於秦曰：「破鄭益晉，非秦之利也。」

translations.literal: Zheng people worried it, then sent person privately to Qin said: 'Break Zheng benefit Jin, not Qin profit.'

sentences.zh: 秦兵罷。

translations.literal: The Qin troops were dismissed.

sentences.zh: 晉文公欲入蘭為太子，以告鄭。

translations.literal: Jin Wen Gong desired to enter Lan as crown prince and told Zheng this.

sentences.zh: 鄭大夫石癸曰：「吾聞姞姓乃后稷之元妃，其後當有興者。

translations.literal: Zheng grandee Shi Gui said: 'I heard Ji surname was Hou Ji primary consort, their descendants ought have prospering.

sentences.zh: 子蘭母，其後也。

translations.literal: Zi Lan's mother is their descendant.

sentences.zh: 且夫人子盡已死，餘庶子無如蘭賢。

translations.literal: Moreover the lady's sons have all already died. The remaining concubine sons are none as worthy as Lan.

sentences.zh: 今圍急，晉以為請，利孰大焉！」

translations.literal: Now siege urgent, Jin with as request, profit who great!'

sentences.zh: 遂許晉，與盟，而卒立子蘭為太子，晉兵乃罷去。

translations.literal: They then permitted Jin and allied with them. They finally established Zi Lan as crown prince. The Jin troops then dismissed and departed.

sentences.zh: 四十五年，文公卒，子蘭立，是為繆公。

translations.literal: In the forty-fifth year, Wen Gong died. Zi Lan was established. This was Mu Gong.

sentences.zh: 繆公元年春，秦繆公使三將將兵欲襲鄭，至滑，逢鄭賈人弦高詐以十二牛勞軍，故秦兵不至而還，晉敗之於崤。

translations.literal: In Mu Gong's first year spring, Qin Mu Gong sent three generals leading troops desiring to raid Zheng. They arrived at Hua and met Zheng merchant Xian Gao who deceived them with twelve oxen to labor the army. Therefore the Qin troops did not arrive but returned. Jin defeated them at Xiao.

sentences.zh: 初，往年鄭文公之卒也，鄭司城繒賀以鄭情賣之，秦兵故來。

translations.literal: Initially, in the previous year when Zheng Wen Gong died, Zheng Si Cheng Zeng He sold the Zheng situation to them. The Qin troops therefore came.

sentences.zh: 三年，鄭發兵從晉伐秦，敗秦兵於汪。

translations.literal: In the third year, Zheng mobilized troops and followed Jin to attack Qin. They defeated the Qin troops at Wang.

sentences.zh: 往年楚太子商臣弒其父成王代立。

translations.literal: In the previous year, Chu crown prince Shang Chen assassinated his father Cheng Wang and replaced him as established.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，與宋華元伐鄭。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, with Song Hua Yuan they attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 華元殺羊食士，不與其御羊斟，怒以馳鄭，鄭囚華元。

translations.literal: Hua Yuan killed a sheep to feed the officers but did not give any to his charioteer Yang Zhen. Yang Zhen angered and galloped to Zheng. Zheng imprisoned Hua Yuan.

sentences.zh: 宋贖華元，元亦亡去。

translations.literal: Song ransomed Hua Yuan. Yuan also fled and departed.

sentences.zh: 晉使趙穿以兵伐鄭。

translations.literal: Jin sent Zhao Chuan with troops to attack Zheng.

sentences.zh: 靈公元年春，楚獻黿於靈公。

translations.literal: In Ling Gong's first year spring, Chu offered a turtle to Ling Gong.

sentences.zh: 子家、子公將朝靈公，子公之食指動，謂子家曰：「佗日指動，必食異物。」

translations.literal: Zi Jia, Zi Gong about attended Ling Gong, Zi Gong index finger moved, told Zi Jia said: 'Other day finger moves, certainly eat different things.'

sentences.zh: 及入，見靈公進黿羹，子公笑曰：「果然！」

translations.literal: When entered, saw Ling Gong advanced turtle soup, Zi Gong laughed said: 'Indeed!'

sentences.zh: 靈公問其笑故，具告靈公。

translations.literal: Ling Gong asked the reason for his laugh. He fully told Ling Gong.

sentences.zh: 靈公召之，獨弗予羹。

translations.literal: Ling Gong summoned them but alone did not give soup.

sentences.zh: 子公怒，染其指，嘗之而出。

translations.literal: Zi Gong angered, dipped his finger, tasted it, and departed.

sentences.zh: 公怒，欲殺子公。

translations.literal: The gong angered and desired to kill Zi Gong.

sentences.zh: 子公與子家謀先。

translations.literal: Zi Gong plotted with Zi Jia to act first.

sentences.zh: 夏，弒靈公。

translations.literal: In summer, they assassinated Ling Gong.

sentences.zh: 鄭人欲立靈公弟去疾，去疾讓曰：「必以賢，則去疾不肖；

translations.literal: Zheng people desired establish Ling Gong younger brother Qu Ji, Qu Ji declined said: 'If must by worthy, then Qu Ji unworthy;

sentences.zh: 必以順，則公子堅長。」

translations.literal: If must by order, then gong zi Jian elder.'

sentences.zh: 堅者，靈公庶弟，去疾之兄也。

translations.literal: Jian was Ling Gong's concubine younger brother and Qu Ji's elder brother.

sentences.zh: 於是乃立子堅，是為襄公。

translations.literal: Thereupon they established Zi Jian. This was Xiang Gong.

sentences.zh: 襄公立，將盡去繆氏。

translations.literal: When Xiang Gong was established, he was about to completely remove the Mu clan.

sentences.zh: 繆氏者，殺靈公、子公之族家也。

translations.literal: The Mu clan were the clan family who assassinated Ling Gong and Zi Gong.

sentences.zh: 去疾曰：「必去繆氏，我將去之。」

translations.literal: Qu Ji said: 'If must remove Mu clan, I will leave.'

sentences.zh: 乃止。

translations.literal: He then stopped.

sentences.zh: 皆以為大夫。

translations.literal: He made them all grandees.

sentences.zh: 襄公元年，楚怒鄭受宋賂縱華元，伐鄭。

translations.literal: In Xiang Gong's first year, Chu angered that Zheng received Song's bribe and released Hua Yuan. They attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 鄭背楚，與晉親。

translations.literal: Zheng turned its back on Chu and befriended Jin.

sentences.zh: 五年，楚復伐鄭，晉來救之。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Chu again attacked Zheng. Jin came and saved them.

sentences.zh: 六年，子家卒，國人復逐其族，以其弒靈公也。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Zi Jia died. The state people again drove his clan because they assassinated Ling Gong.

sentences.zh: 七年，鄭與晉盟鄢陵。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Zheng allied with Jin at Yan Ling.

sentences.zh: 八年，楚莊王以鄭與晉盟，來伐，圍鄭三月，鄭以城降楚。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Chu Zhuang Wang because Zheng allied with Jin came to attack. He surrounded Zheng for three months. Zheng surrendered the city to Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚王入自皇門，鄭襄公肉袒掔羊以迎，曰：「孤不能事邊邑，使君王懷怒以及獘邑，孤之罪也。

translations.literal: Chu wang entered from Huang gate, Zheng Xiang Gong bare flesh led sheep welcomed, said: 'Orphan cannot serve border cities, made lord wang harbor anger reach crippled city, orphan crime.

sentences.zh: 敢不惟命是聽。

translations.literal: How dare I not obey only the command.

sentences.zh: 君王遷之江南，及以賜諸侯，亦惟命是聽。

translations.literal: If the lord wang moves us to Jiang Nan, and grants us to the feudal lords, we also obey only the command.

sentences.zh: 若君王不忘厲、宣王，桓、武公，哀不忍絕其社稷，錫不毛之地，使復得改事君王，孤之願也，然非所敢望也。

translations.literal: If the lord wang does not forget Li and Xuan wang, Huan and Wu gong, and pities not enduring to cut their altars and lands, granting barren land so we may again obtain to change and serve the lord wang - that is the orphan's wish, however not what I dare hope for.

sentences.zh: 敢布腹心，惟命是聽。」

translations.literal: How dare spread abdomen heart, only command obey.'

sentences.zh: 莊王為卻三十里而後舍。

translations.literal: Zhuang Wang retreated thirty li and then camped.

sentences.zh: 楚群臣曰：「自郢至此，士大夫亦久勞矣。

translations.literal: Chu ministers said: 'From Ying to here, officers also long labored.

sentences.zh: 今得國捨之，何如？」

translations.literal: Now obtain state abandon it, what like?'

sentences.zh: 莊王曰：「所為伐，伐不服也。

translations.literal: Zhuang Wang said: 'What for attack, attack not submit.

sentences.zh: 今已服，尚何求乎？」

translations.literal: Now already submit, still what seek?'

sentences.zh: 卒去。

translations.literal: They finally departed.

sentences.zh: 晉聞楚之伐鄭，發兵救鄭。

translations.literal: Jin heard that Chu had attacked Zheng and mobilized troops to save Zheng.

sentences.zh: 其來持兩端，故遲，比至河，楚兵已去。

translations.literal: Their coming held both ends, therefore they were slow. By the time they arrived at the river, the Chu troops had already gone.

sentences.zh: 晉將率或欲渡，或欲還，卒渡河。

translations.literal: The Jin generals, some desired to cross, some desired to return. They finally crossed the river.

sentences.zh: 莊王聞，還擊晉。

translations.literal: Zhuang Wang heard and returned to attack Jin.

sentences.zh: 鄭反助楚，大破晉軍於河上。

translations.literal: Zheng instead assisted Chu and greatly broke the Jin army on the river.

sentences.zh: 十年，晉來伐鄭，以其反晉而親楚也。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Jin came to attack Zheng because they had turned their backs on Jin and befriended Chu.

sentences.zh: 十一年，楚莊王伐宋，宋告急于晉。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Chu Zhuang Wang attacked Song. Song urgently informed Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉景公欲發兵救宋，伯宗諫晉君曰：「天方開楚，未可伐也。」

translations.literal: Jin Jing Gong desired mobilize troops save Song, Bo Zong admonished Jin lord said: 'Heaven just prospering Chu, not yet can attack.'

sentences.zh: 乃求壯士得霍人解揚，字子虎，誆楚，令宋毋降。

translations.literal: They then sought a strong man and obtained Huo person Jie Yang, styled Zi Hu, to deceive Chu and command Song not to surrender.

sentences.zh: 過鄭，鄭與楚親，乃執解揚而獻楚。

translations.literal: He passed through Zheng. Zheng was close with Chu, so they seized Jie Yang and offered him to Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚王厚賜與約，使反其言，令宋趣降，三要乃許。

translations.literal: The Chu wang thickly granted him and allied with him, made him reverse his words, commanded Song to hurry and surrender. After three demands he permitted.

sentences.zh: 於是楚登解揚樓車，令呼宋。

translations.literal: Thereupon Chu mounted Jie Yang on a tower chariot and commanded him to call to Song.

sentences.zh: 遂負楚約而致其晉君命曰：「晉方悉國兵以救宋，宋雖急，慎毋降楚，晉兵今至矣！」

translations.literal: Then violated Chu agreement conveyed his Jin lord command said: 'Jin just all state troops to save Song, Song though urgent, careful not surrender Chu, Jin troops now arrived!'

sentences.zh: 楚莊王大怒，將殺之。

translations.literal: Chu Zhuang Wang was greatly angered and about to kill him.

sentences.zh: 解揚曰：「君能制命為義，臣能承命為信。

translations.literal: Jie Yang said: 'Lord able determine command as righteousness, minister able receive command as faith.

sentences.zh: 受吾君命以出，有死無隕。」

translations.literal: Received my lord command to go out, have death no disgrace.'

sentences.zh: 莊王曰：「若之許我，已而背之，其信安在？」

translations.literal: Zhuang Wang said: 'You permitted me, already then betrayed me, its faith where?'

sentences.zh: 解揚曰：「所以許王，欲以成吾君命也。」

translations.literal: Jie Yang said: 'Reason permitted wang, desired to complete my lord command.'

sentences.zh: 將死，顧謂楚軍曰：「為人臣無忘盡忠得死者！」

translations.literal: About to die, looked back told Chu army said: 'As minister not forget exhaust loyalty obtain death!'

sentences.zh: 楚王諸弟皆諫王赦之，於是赦解揚使歸。

translations.literal: The Chu wang's various younger brothers all admonished the wang to pardon him. Thereupon he pardoned Jie Yang and made him return.

sentences.zh: 晉爵之為上卿。

translations.literal: Jin enfeoffed him as an upper minister.

sentences.zh: 十八年，襄公卒，子悼公沸立。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Xiang Gong died. His son Dao Gong Fei was established.

sentences.zh: 悼公元年，鄦公惡鄭於楚，悼公使弟睔於楚自訟。

translations.literal: In Dao Gong's first year, Mao Gong slandered Zheng at Chu. Dao Gong sent his younger brother Gai to Chu to argue on his own behalf.

sentences.zh: 訟不直，楚囚睔。

translations.literal: The argument was not just. Chu imprisoned Gai.

sentences.zh: 於是鄭悼公來與晉平，遂親。

translations.literal: Thereupon Zheng Dao Gong came and made peace with Jin, then became close.

sentences.zh: 睔私於楚子反，子反言歸睔於鄭。

translations.literal: Gai was privately close with Chu Zi Fan. Zi Fan spoke and returned Gai to Zheng.

sentences.zh: 二年，楚伐鄭，晉兵來救。

translations.literal: In the second year, Chu attacked Zheng. Jin troops came to save.

sentences.zh: 是歲，悼公卒，立其弟睔，是為成公。

translations.literal: This year, Dao Gong died. They established his younger brother Gai. This was Cheng Gong.

sentences.zh: 成公三年，楚共王曰「鄭成公孤有德焉」，使人來與盟。

translations.literal: Cheng Gong third year, Chu Gong Wang said 'Zheng Cheng Gong orphan has virtue there', sent person came allied.

sentences.zh: 成公私與盟。

translations.literal: Cheng Gong privately allied.

sentences.zh: 秋，成公朝晉，晉曰「鄭私平於楚」，執之。

translations.literal: Autumn, Cheng Gong attended Jin, Jin said 'Zheng privately peace with Chu', seized him.

sentences.zh: 使欒書伐鄭。

translations.literal: They sent Luan Shu to attack Zheng.

sentences.zh: 四年春，鄭患晉圍，公子如乃立成公庶兄繻為君。

translations.literal: In the fourth year spring, Zheng worried about the Jin siege. Gong zi Ru then established Cheng Gong's concubine elder brother Xu as lord.

sentences.zh: 其四月，晉聞鄭立君，乃歸成公。

translations.literal: In its fourth month, Jin heard Zheng had established a lord and then returned Cheng Gong.

sentences.zh: 鄭人聞成公歸，亦殺君繻，迎成公。

translations.literal: The Zheng people heard Cheng Gong had returned. They also killed lord Xu and welcomed Cheng Gong.

sentences.zh: 晉兵去。

translations.literal: The Jin troops departed.

sentences.zh: 十年，背晉盟，盟於楚。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, they turned their backs on the Jin alliance and allied with Chu.

sentences.zh: 晉厲公怒，發兵伐鄭。

translations.literal: Jin Li Gong was angered and mobilized troops to attack Zheng.

sentences.zh: 楚共王救鄭。

translations.literal: Chu Gong Wang saved Zheng.

sentences.zh: 晉楚戰鄢陵，楚兵敗，晉射傷楚共王目，俱罷而去。

translations.literal: Jin and Chu battled at Yan Ling. Chu troops were defeated. Jin shot and injured Chu Gong Wang's eye. Both dismissed and departed.

sentences.zh: 十三年，晉悼公伐鄭，兵於洧上。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Jin Dao Gong attacked Zheng with troops at Wei Shang.

sentences.zh: 鄭城守，晉亦去。

translations.literal: Zheng defended the city. Jin also departed.

sentences.zh: 十四年，成公卒，子惲立。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Cheng Gong died. His son Yun was established.

sentences.zh: 是為釐公。

translations.literal: This was Xi Gong.

sentences.zh: 釐公五年，鄭相子駟朝釐公，釐公不禮。

translations.literal: In Xi Gong's fifth year, Zheng chancellor Zi Si attended Xi Gong. Xi Gong did not treat him with courtesy.

sentences.zh: 子駟怒，使廚人藥殺釐公，赴諸侯曰「釐公暴病卒」。

translations.literal: Zi Si angered, made cook poison killed Xi Gong, announced feudal lords said 'Xi Gong sudden illness died'.

sentences.zh: 立釐公子嘉，嘉時年五歲，是為簡公。

translations.literal: They established Xi Gong's son Jia. Jia was five years old at the time. This was Jian Gong.

sentences.zh: 簡公元年，諸公子謀欲誅相子駟，子駟覺之，反盡誅諸公子。

translations.literal: In Jian Gong's first year, the various gong zi plotted to execute chancellor Zi Si. Zi Si became aware of it and instead completely executed the various gong zi.

sentences.zh: 二年，晉伐鄭，鄭與盟，晉去。

translations.literal: In the second year, Jin attacked Zheng. Zheng allied with them. Jin departed.

sentences.zh: 冬，又與楚盟。

translations.literal: In winter, they moreover allied with Chu.

sentences.zh: 子駟畏誅，故兩親晉、楚。

translations.literal: Zi Si feared execution, therefore he befriended both Jin and Chu.

sentences.zh: 三年，相子駟欲自立為君，公子子孔使尉止殺相子駟而代之。

translations.literal: In the third year, chancellor Zi Si desired to establish himself as lord. Gong zi Zi Kong made Wei Zhi kill chancellor Zi Si and replace him.

sentences.zh: 子孔又欲自立。

translations.literal: Zi Kong moreover desired to establish himself.

sentences.zh: 子產曰：「子駟為不可，誅之，今又效之，是亂無時息也。」

translations.literal: Zi Chan said: 'Zi Si did what could not be done, executed him, now moreover imitate it, this chaos has no time to rest.'

sentences.zh: 於是子孔從之而相鄭簡公。

translations.literal: Thereupon Zi Kong followed this and became chancellor to Zheng Jian Gong.

sentences.zh: 四年，晉怒鄭與楚盟，伐鄭，鄭與盟。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Jin was angered that Zheng allied with Chu. They attacked Zheng. Zheng allied with them.

sentences.zh: 楚共王救鄭，敗晉兵。

translations.literal: Chu Gong Wang saved Zheng and defeated the Jin troops.

sentences.zh: 簡公欲與晉平，楚又囚鄭使者。

translations.literal: Jian Gong desired peace with Jin. Chu moreover imprisoned the Zheng envoy.

sentences.zh: 十二年，簡公怒相子孔專國權，誅之，而以子產為卿。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Jian Gong was angered that chancellor Zi Kong monopolized state authority. He executed him and made Zi Chan a minister.

sentences.zh: 十九年，簡公如晉請衛君還，而封子產以六邑。

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, Jian Gong went to Jin and requested the Wei lord's return. He enfeoffed Zi Chan with six cities.

sentences.zh: 子產讓，受其三邑。

translations.literal: Zi Chan declined but received three of the cities.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，吳使延陵季子於鄭，見子產如舊交，謂子產曰：「鄭之執政者侈，難將至，政將及子。

translations.literal: Twenty-second year, Wu sent Yan Ling Ji Zi to Zheng, saw Zi Chan like old friend, told Zi Chan said: 'Zheng governing officials extravagant, calamity will arrive, governance will reach you.

sentences.zh: 子為政，必以禮；

translations.literal: You govern, certainly with rites;

sentences.zh: 不然，鄭將敗。」

translations.literal: Not so, Zheng will defeat.'

sentences.zh: 子產厚遇季子。

translations.literal: Zi Chan treated Ji Zi generously.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，諸公子爭寵相殺，又欲殺子產。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, the various gong zi contended for favor and killed each other. They moreover desired to kill Zi Chan.

sentences.zh: 公子或諫曰：「子產仁人，鄭所以存者子產也，勿殺！」

translations.literal: Gong zi some admonished said: 'Zi Chan benevolent person, Zheng reason exists Zi Chan, not kill!'

sentences.zh: 乃止。

translations.literal: They then stopped.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，鄭使子產於晉，問平公疾。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Zheng sent Zi Chan to Jin to inquire about Ping Gong's illness.

sentences.zh: 平公曰：「卜而曰實沈、臺駘為祟，史官莫知，敢問？」

translations.literal: Ping Gong said: 'Divined and said Shi Shen, Tai Tai caused calamity, historians none know, dare ask?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「高辛氏有二子，長曰閼伯，季曰實沈，居曠林，不相能也，日操干戈以相征伐。

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Gao Xin Shi had two sons, elder called Yan Bo, younger called Shi Shen, resided vast forest, not compatible, daily grasped spear shield mutually attacked.

sentences.zh: 后帝弗臧，遷閼伯于商丘，主辰，商人是因，故辰為商星。

translations.literal: Hou Di did not approve. He moved Yan Bo to Shang Qiu to rule Chen. The Shang people followed this. Therefore Chen became the Shang star.

sentences.zh: 遷實沈于大夏，主參，唐人是因，服事夏、商，其季世曰唐叔虞。

translations.literal: He moved Shi Shen to Da Xia to rule Shen. The Tang people followed this. They served Xia and Shang. Their later generations were called Tang Shu Yu.

sentences.zh: 當武王邑姜方娠大叔，夢帝謂己：『余命而子曰虞，乃與之唐，屬之參而蕃育其子孫。』

translations.literal: At Wu Wang Yi Jiang just pregnant Da Shu, dreamed Di told self: 'I name your son Yu, then give him Tang, attach him Shen and multiply nurture his descendants.'

sentences.zh: 及生有文在其掌曰『虞』，遂以命之。

translations.literal: When born had writing on his palm said 'Yu', then named him thus.

sentences.zh: 及成王滅唐而國大叔焉。

translations.literal: When Cheng Wang extinguished Tang, he then enfeoffed Da Shu there.

sentences.zh: 故參為晉星。

translations.literal: Therefore Shen is the Jin star.

sentences.zh: 由是觀之，則實沈，參神也。

translations.literal: From this observation, Shi Shen is the Shen spirit.

sentences.zh: 昔金天氏有裔子曰昧，為玄冥師，生允格、臺駘。

translations.literal: Formerly Jin Tian Shi had a descendant son called Mei who was the Xuan Ming teacher. He gave birth to Yun Ge and Tai Tai.

sentences.zh: 臺駘能業其官，宣汾、洮，障大澤，以處太原。

translations.literal: Tai Tai was able to manage his office. He drained the Fen and Tao, blocked the great marsh, to reside in Tai Yuan.

sentences.zh: 帝用嘉之，國之汾川。

translations.literal: The Di praised him and enfeoffed him at Fen Chuan.

sentences.zh: 沈、姒、蓐、黃實守其祀。

translations.literal: Shen, Si, Ru, and Huang truly guarded his sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 今晉主汾川而滅之。

translations.literal: Now Jin rules Fen Chuan but extinguished them.

sentences.zh: 由是觀之，則臺駘，汾、洮神也。

translations.literal: From this observation, Tai Tai is the Fen and Tao spirit.

sentences.zh: 然是二者不害君身。

translations.literal: However these two do not harm the lord's body.

sentences.zh: 山川之神，則水旱之菑禜之；

translations.literal: Mountains rivers spirits, then drought flood calamities sacrifice to them;

sentences.zh: 日月星辰之神，則雪霜風雨不時禜之；

translations.literal: Sun moon star spirits, then snow frost wind rain not timely sacrifice to them;

sentences.zh: 若君疾，飲食哀樂女色所生也。」

translations.literal: If lord illness, eating drinking sorrow joy female beauty produced.'

sentences.zh: 平公及叔向曰：「善，博物君子也！」

translations.literal: Ping Gong and Shu Xiang said: 'Good, broadly learned gentleman!'

sentences.zh: 厚為之禮於子產。

translations.literal: They made generous rites for Zi Chan.

sentences.zh: 二十七年夏，鄭簡公朝晉。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year summer, Zheng Jian Gong attended Jin.

sentences.zh: 冬，畏楚靈王之彊，又朝楚，子產從。

translations.literal: In winter, fearing Chu Ling Wang's strength, he moreover attended Chu. Zi Chan followed.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，鄭君病，使子產會諸侯，與楚靈王盟於申，誅齊慶封。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, the Zheng lord was ill. He sent Zi Chan to assemble the feudal lords and ally with Chu Ling Wang at Shen. They executed Qi Qing Feng.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，簡公卒，子定公寧立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, Jian Gong died. His son Ding Gong Ning was established.

sentences.zh: 秋，定公朝晉昭公。

translations.literal: In autumn, Ding Gong attended Jin Zhao Gong.

sentences.zh: 定公元年，楚公子棄疾弒其君靈王而自立，為平王。

translations.literal: In Ding Gong's first year, Chu gong zi Qi Ji assassinated his lord Ling Wang and established himself, becoming Ping Wang.

sentences.zh: 欲行德諸侯。

translations.literal: He desired to practice virtue among the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 歸靈王所侵鄭地于鄭。

translations.literal: He returned the lands that Ling Wang had invaded from Zheng back to Zheng.

sentences.zh: 四年，晉昭公卒，其六卿彊，公室卑。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Jin Zhao Gong died. His six ministers were strong, the gong chamber lowly.

sentences.zh: 子產謂韓宣子曰：「為政必以德，毋忘所以立。」

translations.literal: Zi Chan told Han Xuan Zi said: 'Govern certainly with virtue, not forget reason established.'

sentences.zh: 六年，鄭火，公欲禳之。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Zheng had a fire. The gong desired to exorcise it.

sentences.zh: 子產曰：「不如修德。」

translations.literal: Zi Chan said: 'Not as cultivate virtue.'

sentences.zh: 八年，楚太子建來奔。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Chu crown prince Jian came fleeing.

sentences.zh: 十年，太子建與晉謀襲鄭。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, crown prince Jian plotted with Jin to raid Zheng.

sentences.zh: 鄭殺建，建子勝奔吳。

translations.literal: Zheng killed Jian. Jian's son Sheng fled to Wu.

sentences.zh: 十一年，定公如晉。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Ding Gong went to Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉與鄭謀，誅周亂臣，入敬王于周。

translations.literal: Jin plotted with Zheng, executed Zhou's chaotic ministers, and entered Jing Wang into Zhou.

sentences.zh: 十三年，定公卒，子獻公蠆立。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Ding Gong died. His son Xian Gong Juan was established.

sentences.zh: 獻公十三年卒，子聲公勝立。

translations.literal: Xian Gong died in the thirteenth year. His son Sheng Gong Sheng was established.

sentences.zh: 當是時，晉六卿彊，侵奪鄭，鄭遂弱。

translations.literal: At this time, Jin's six ministers were strong. They invaded and seized from Zheng. Zheng then became weak.

sentences.zh: 聲公五年，鄭相子產卒，鄭人皆哭泣，悲之如亡親戚。

translations.literal: In Sheng Gong's fifth year, Zheng chancellor Zi Chan died. All Zheng people wept and grieved him like lost relatives.

sentences.zh: 子產者，鄭成公少子也。

translations.literal: Zi Chan was Zheng Cheng Gong's younger son.

sentences.zh: 為人仁愛人，事君忠厚。

translations.literal: As a person he was benevolent and loved people. He served his lord with loyal generosity.

sentences.zh: 孔子嘗過鄭，與子產如兄弟云。

translations.literal: Kong Qiu once passed through Zheng and was like brothers with Zi Chan, they say.

sentences.zh: 及聞子產死，孔子為泣曰：「古之遺愛也！」

translations.literal: When heard Zi Chan died, Kong Qiu wept said: 'Ancient legacy love!'

sentences.zh: 八年，晉范、中行氏反晉，告急於鄭，鄭救之。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Jin's Fan and Zhong Xing clans rebelled against Jin. They urgently informed Zheng. Zheng saved them.

sentences.zh: 晉伐鄭，敗鄭軍於鐵。

translations.literal: Jin attacked Zheng and defeated the Zheng army at Tie.

sentences.zh: 十四年，宋景公滅曹。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Song Jing Gong extinguished Cao.

sentences.zh: 二十年，齊田常弒其君簡公，而常相於齊。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, Qi's Tian Chang assassinated his lord Jian Gong, and Chang became chancellor at Qi.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，楚惠王滅陳。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Chu Hui Wang extinguished Chen.

sentences.zh: 孔子卒。

translations.literal: Kong Qiu died.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，晉知伯伐鄭，取九邑。

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, Jin's Zhi Bo attacked Zheng and took nine cities.

sentences.zh: 三十七年，聲公卒，子哀公易立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-seventh year, Sheng Gong died. His son Ai Gong Yi was established.

sentences.zh: 哀公八年，鄭人弒哀公而立聲公弟丑，是為共公。

translations.literal: In Ai Gong's eighth year, the Zheng people assassinated Ai Gong and established Sheng Gong's younger brother Chou. This was Gong Gong.

sentences.zh: 共公三年，三晉滅知伯。

translations.literal: In Gong Gong's third year, the three Jin extinguished Zhi Bo.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，共公卒，子幽公已立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-first year, Gong Gong died. His son You Gong Ji was established.

sentences.zh: 幽公元年，韓武子伐鄭，殺幽公。

translations.literal: In You Gong's first year, Han Wu Zi attacked Zheng and killed You Gong.

sentences.zh: 鄭人立幽公弟駘，是為繻公。

translations.literal: The Zheng people established You Gong's younger brother Tai. This was Xu Gong.

sentences.zh: 繻公十五年，韓景侯伐鄭，取雍丘。

translations.literal: In Xu Gong's fifteenth year, Han Jing Hou attacked Zheng and took Yong Qiu.

sentences.zh: 鄭城京。

translations.literal: Zheng fortified Jing.

sentences.zh: 十六年，鄭伐韓，敗韓兵於負黍。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Zheng attacked Han and defeated Han troops at Fu Shu.

sentences.zh: 二十年，韓、趙、魏列為諸侯。

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, Han, Zhao, and Wei were ranked as feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，鄭圍韓之陽翟。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Zheng surrounded Han's Yang Di.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，鄭君殺其相子陽。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, the Zheng lord killed his chancellor Zi Yang.

sentences.zh: 二十七，子陽之黨共弒繻公駘而立幽公弟乙為君，是為鄭君。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, Zi Yang's party together assassinated Xu Gong Tai and established You Gong's younger brother Yi as lord. This was the Zheng lord.

sentences.zh: 鄭君乙立二年，鄭負黍反，復歸韓。

translations.literal: Zheng lord Yi established for two years. Zheng's Fu Shu rebelled and again returned to Han.

sentences.zh: 十一年，韓伐鄭，取陽城。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Han attacked Zheng and took Yang Cheng.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，韓哀侯滅鄭，并其國。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Han Ai Hou extinguished Zheng and annexed its state.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：語有之，「以權利合者，權利盡而交疏」，甫瑕是也。

translations.literal: Tai Shi Gong said: Speech has it, 'Those who unite by power profit, power profit exhaust relation distant', Fu Xia is also.

sentences.zh: 甫瑕雖以劫殺鄭子內厲公，厲公終背而殺之，此與晉之裏克何異？

translations.literal: Fu Xia though with kidnap killed Zheng Zi entered Li Gong, Li Gong finally turned back killed him, this with Jin Li Ke what different?

sentences.zh: 守節如荀息，身死而不能存奚齊。

translations.literal: One who guarded integrity like Xun Xi died but could not preserve Xi Qi.

sentences.zh: 變所從來，亦多故矣！

translations.literal: Changes from where come, also many troubles!
